title: How to make a DIY a mute for a trumpet, tuba, or other brass instrument - Quora

response.answer_text: As a tuba player, I’ve had that same question all the time! So I suggest that for trumpet and trombone, or other brass instruments with the smaller bells to go to the store and buy a new toilet plunger and just use the plunger part. For other bigger brass instruments I don’t know sorry. I hope that I was able to be of some help

I never tried. When composers/arrangers specify mutes, they know what they want and they anticipate the sound they’ll get. If my home-made cup mute or harmon mute sounds different, they won’t like it and I will not be able to blend with the rest of the section. Time and effort wasted.
